questions.question: my pc won't turn on at all
questions.answer:
Complete no-power troubleshooting:
• Check power cable is firmly plugged in at both ends
• Try a different wall outlet (test with a lamp)
• Hold power button 40–60 seconds to drain flea power
• Remove and reseat RAM sticks
• Check front panel power switch connectors on motherboard
• Try minimal boot: motherboard + CPU + 1 RAM + PSU only
• If desktop, test with a known-good PSU if possible

questions.question: laptop completely dead no lights
questions.answer:
Laptop no signs of life:
1. Hold power button 40+ seconds (drain residual power)
2. Remove battery (if removable) + unplug charger → hold power 60s → reconnect
3. Try charging with a different known-good charger
4. Check charging port for damage/bent pins
5. Remove bottom panel → disconnect battery cable → hold power button 30s → reconnect
6. If still dead → likely failed motherboard or power IC

questions.question: pc turns on for 1 second then shuts off
questions.answer:
Classic short circuit or PSU failure:
• Remove GPU, extra drives, all USB devices
• Reseat RAM and CPU power cables
• Check for loose screws or standoffs under motherboard
• Try booting with only motherboard + CPU + 1 RAM stick
• 90% chance it's a failing power supply → replace PSU

questions.question: desktop no power but power supply fan spins
questions.answer:
Power supply is alive but not delivering correct voltages:
• Test with a PSU tester or paperclip test
• Reseat 24-pin and CPU power cables
• Try a different power supply if available
• Check motherboard for blown capacitors or burn marks

questions.question: pc randomly shuts down
questions.answer:
95% of random shutdowns are:
1. Overheating → download HWMonitor → check if CPU/GPU hits 95–105°C
2. Failing power supply (very common on 4+ year old PCs)
3. Bad RAM or VRMs

Immediate actions:
• Clean ALL dust from fans/heatsinks (fixes 70% of cases)
• Repaste CPU if older than 3 years
• Run MemTest86 overnight
• Check Windows Event Viewer → Critical Kernel-Power Event ID 41

questions.question: laptop shuts down randomly
questions.answer:
Laptop-specific causes:
• Dust-clogged cooling system (most common)
• Dried thermal paste/pads
• Battery failing (causes shutdown even when plugged in)
• Power adapter failing under load

Fix order:
1. Clean vents and fans thoroughly
2. Elevate laptop for better airflow
3. Run powercfg /batteryreport
4. Test with battery removed (plugged in only)
5. Replace thermal paste if 3+ years old

questions.question: pc restarts randomly
questions.answer:
Same causes as shutdowns + BSODs happening too fast to see:
• Enable 'Automatic restart on system failure' OFF in Windows
• Check Event Viewer for WHEA_Uncorrectable_Error or Kernel Power 41
• Update BIOS if available
• Stress test with Prime95 + FurMark to force the issue

questions.question: laptop getting very hot
questions.answer:
Immediate actions:
• Clean all vents and fans with compressed air
• Use on hard flat surface (not bed/blanket)
• Download HWMonitor → monitor temps
• Undervolt CPU/GPU with ThrottleStop or Intel XTU
• Repaste CPU/GPU if 2+ years old
• Consider laptop cooling pad

Danger zone: >90°C sustained = permanent damage risk

questions.question: fans always loud
questions.answer:
Constant high fan speed means:
• Dust buildup (90% of cases)
• Windows power plan set to High Performance
• Background processes (check Task Manager)
• Dried thermal paste

Fixes:
1. Clean dust thoroughly
2. Set power plan to Balanced
3. Repaste CPU/GPU
4. Update BIOS for better fan curves

questions.question: why is my computer so slow
questions.answer:
Top real causes in 2025:
1. Still on HDD → upgrade to SSD (biggest speed boost)
2. Less than 16GB RAM → upgrade to 32GB
3. Too many startup programs
4. Malware or bloatware
5. Full C: drive
6. Overheating causing throttling

Quick fixes:
• Run Malwarebytes scan
• Disable startup apps in Task Manager
• Clean disk with Storage Sense
• Upgrade to SSD + fresh Windows install = like new PC

questions.question: laptop slow all of a sudden
questions.answer:
Sudden slowdown usually:
• Windows update gone wrong
• Antivirus doing full scan
• Cryptominer malware
• Thermal throttling from dust

Do this now:
1. Open Task Manager → sort by CPU/Disk
2. Run Malwarebytes + HitmanPro
3. Roll back recent Windows update
4. Clean dust from fans

questions.question: black screen but fans spinning
questions.answer:
Hardware is running but no display:
• Reseat RAM completely
• Try HDMI vs DisplayPort
• Boot with only integrated graphics (remove GPU)
• Clear CMOS (remove battery or jumper)
• Shine flashlight on screen → can you see faint image? → backlight or inverter failure

questions.question: no display after startup
questions.answer:
Try this exact order:
1. Different cable/monitor
2. Reseat GPU + power cables
3. Boot with integrated graphics
4. Clear CMOS
5. Remove and reseat RAM
6. Check for bent CPU pins (carefully!)

questions.question: screen flickering
questions.answer:
Common causes:
• Bad cable (try different HDMI/DP)
• Wrong refresh rate (set to 60Hz)
• Outdated GPU drivers → use DDU to clean install
• Faulty monitor → test on another PC

questions.question: hard drive making clicking noise
questions.answer:
CRITICAL: Your mechanical HDD is dying!
• STOP using it immediately
• DO NOT run chkdsk or defrag
• Backup important data NOW using another PC if possible
• Replace with SSD immediately
• Use professional recovery service only if data is irreplaceable

questions.question: disk is full
questions.answer:
Free up space fast:
• Run Disk Cleanup as admin
• Delete %temp% folder
• Uninstall unused programs
• Move Documents/Downloads to D: drive
• Use TreeSize Free to find largest files
• Empty Recycle Bin

questions.question: blue screen of death
questions.answer:
Write down the stop code! Common ones:
• MEMORY_MANAGEMENT → bad RAM → run MemTest86
• IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL → driver conflict → update all drivers
• PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA → bad storage/driver
• CRITICAL_PROCESS_DIED → system file corruption → run sfc /scannow + DISM

Always:
1. Update Windows
2. Update all drivers from manufacturer sites
3. Run memory diagnostic

questions.question: laptop keyboard not working
questions.answer:
Try this order:
1. Restart twice
2. Plug in external USB keyboard (does it work?)
3. Update keyboard driver in Device Manager
4. Uninstall recent Windows update
5. Boot into BIOS → does keyboard work there?
   → Yes = Windows issue
   → No = hardware failure (needs replacement)

questions.question: some keys not working on laptop
questions.answer:
Usually debris or liquid damage:
• Turn laptop upside down and shake gently
• Use compressed air between keys
• Clean with isopropyl alcohol + cotton swab
• If sticky → likely liquid damage → needs professional cleaning or replacement

questions.question: spilled water on laptop keyboard
questions.answer:
EMERGENCY LIQUID SPILL PROCEDURE:
1. POWER OFF IMMEDIATELY
2. Unplug charger
3. Remove battery if possible
4. Turn upside down (keyboard facing down)
5. Blot (don’t wipe) with paper towel
6. DO NOT use hairdryer or rice
7. Leave upside down in front of fan for 72+ hours
8. Pray and try powering on

questions.question: no sound from laptop
questions.answer:
Check these in order:
1. Volume mixer (is app muted?)
2. Correct playback device selected
3. Update audio drivers from manufacturer
4. Run Windows Audio Troubleshooter
5. Restart Windows Audio service
6. Test with headphones
7. Reinstall Realtek/Conexant drivers

questions.question: no internet connection
questions.answer:
Full Wi-Fi troubleshooting:
1. Restart router + modem
2. Forget network → reconnect
3. Run Windows Network Troubleshooter
4. ipconfig /release → /renew
5. netsh int ip reset
6. Update Wi-Fi drivers
7. Disable VPN/antivirus temporarily
8. Try phone hotspot → works? → router issue

questions.question: wifi keeps dropping
questions.answer:
Usually interference or driver issue:
• Change Wi-Fi channel in router settings
• Update Wi-Fi drivers
• Disable power saving for Wi-Fi adapter
• Move closer to router or use 5GHz band
• Check for microwave/cordless phone interference

questions.question: laptop battery not charging
questions.answer:
Try this exact sequence:
1. Unplug charger → hold power button 60s → plug back in
2. Try different charger
3. Remove battery (if removable) → plug in directly
4. Run powercfg /batteryreport
5. Update BIOS + chipset drivers
6. Battery may be dead (2–4 year lifespan)
7. If swollen → REPLACE IMMEDIATELY (fire hazard!)

questions.question: stuck on automatic repair
questions.answer:
Windows failed to boot:
1. Power off completely 3 times → enter Recovery
2. Try Startup Repair
3. System Restore to earlier point
4. Command Prompt → bootrec /fixmbr → /fixboot → /rebuildbcd
5. If SSD → check cable or try different SATA port
6. Last resort → reset Windows keeping files

questions.question: computer smells like burning
questions.answer:
IMMEDIATE SAFETY HAZARD!
• UNPLUG FROM POWER NOW
• DO NOT touch if hot
• Open case → locate source (usually PSU or GPU)
• If smoke continues → evacuate and call fire department
• Do not use until professionally inspected

questions.question: laptop battery swollen
questions.answer:
DANGER: Swollen battery can explode!
• STOP using immediately
• Do not puncture or charge
• Remove battery carefully (wear gloves)
• Store in cool place away from flammable items
• Replace with genuine battery only
